values.title: "DeletingPods - With no errors" takes a long time

content.raw:
Hello,

last night I tried new AWS images \(2019-12-20\), started two simulations of two robots \(first one was by accident that I did not notice that my docker image took much longer time to upload, so the second run was “just for sure” when the image was already available\). In both cases I tried “robotika configuration”. Now \(11 hours after?\) it is still in “DeletingPods” stage - is it expected? I am posting it here if other competitors have similar issue? Maybe it is expected and instead of 5 minutes the robot was stuck for the whole simulation hour??

robotika, ver34p1b, ba1c031c-7f02-42e3-b47c-cf5e0b405e02, urban practice 1

p.s. also thanks for “info button” for older simulations - it helps :slight_smile:
content.html:
Hello,

last night I tried new AWS images (2019-12-20), started two simulations of two robots (first one was by accident that I did not notice that my docker image took much longer time to upload, so the second run was “just for sure” when the image was already available). In both cases I tried “robotika configuration”. Now (11 hours after?) it is still in “DeletingPods” stage - is it expected? I am posting it here if other competitors have similar issue? Maybe it is expected and instead of 5 minutes the robot was stuck for the whole simulation hour??

robotika, ver34p1b, ba1c031c-7f02-42e3-b47c-cf5e0b405e02, urban practice 1

p.s. also thanks for “info button” for older simulations - it helps

Using the configuration X2\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_6 with command 

`ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign worldName:=simple_urban_01 headless:=true robotName1:=X2n1 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_6`

values.title: Could NOT find rotors_control (missing: rotors_control_DIR)

content.raw:
I’m reinstalling SubT following your instructions:

```
sudo apt-get remove ros-melodic-ros*
sudo apt-get install --reinstall ros-melodic-ros-ign  #(NOT ros1)
sudo reboot
```

```
rm -rfv subt_ws
mkdir -p ~/subt_ws/src && cd ~/subt_ws/src
hg clone #!/osrf/subt -b urban_circuit
source /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
cd ~/subt_ws/
catkin_make install
```

and `catkin_make` fails:

```
-- +++ processing catkin package: 'subt_rotors_controller'
-- ==> add_subdirectory(subt/subt_rotors_controller)
-- Could NOT find rotors_control (missing: rotors_control_DIR)
-- Could not find the required component 'rotors_control'. The following CMake error indicates that you either need to install the package with the same name or change your environment so that it can be found.
CMake Error at /opt/ros/melodic/share/catkin/cmake/catkinConfig.cmake:83 (find_package):
  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "rotors_control"
  with any of the following names:

    rotors_controlConfig.cmake
    rotors_control-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "rotors_control" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "rotors_control_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If
  "rotors_control" provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it
  has been installed.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  subt/subt_rotors_controller/CMakeLists.txt:8 (find_package)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/paul/subt_ws/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/paul/subt_ws/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Invoking "cmake" failed
```

‌

values.title: Unstable rotor control

content.raw:
Using the new velocity control interface for the rotors, they become unstable if there is disk usage in the computer \(for example recording a ROS bag\). This is easily reproducible, you just need to make the rotor hover and then run the command.

' stress -hdd 20'

‌
content.html:
Using the new velocity control interface for the rotors, they become unstable if there is disk usage in the computer (for example recording a ROS bag). This is easily reproducible, you just need to make the rotor hover and then run the command.

' stress -hdd 20'

‌

values.title: Huge odometry errors

content.raw:
I’m driving a single circle around the base area \(teleoperated with speed smoothing, 10 Hz twist update\) with these parameters:

* V linear max = 1 m/s
* V angular max = 0.2 rad/s
* V' linear = 0.2 m/s\*s
* V' angular = 0.07 rad/s\*s.

They seem to be on the gentle end of kinematics, but I’m getting huge odometry errors:

* COSTAR\_HUSKY: 1.1 m
* Small skid-steer UGV: 0.7 m

Is this normal?

values.title: Simulator died (once randomly) at startup

content.raw:
Was launching the sim using the following, as I have done hundreds of times:

```
ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign worldName:=urban_qual robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_6
```

This time, something died and I was returned to the prompt - but one of the two ruby processes was still going, as were the parameter bridges and relay.

```
Inconsistency detected by ld.so: ../elf/dl-tls.c: 481: _dl_allocate_tls_init: Assertion `listp->slotinfo[cnt].gen <= GL(dl_tls_generation)' failed!
```

No idea how to reproduce, as this was a freak occurrence.

Full output attached.

‌

‌

values.title: Wrong acceleration readings from IMU in rotors

content.raw:
After spending a significant amount of time debugging why our Inertial \+ Visual odometers don’t work, we have found out that the IMU readings in the X and Y direction of the linear acceleration are wrong. 

This can be reproduced extracting the ground truth velocity of the robot in the simulator, differentiating it, adding the gravity vector, and expressing the resultant quantity in the local reference frame of the robot. 

By simple inspection of the IMU signal, it can be seen that the readings for the linear acceleration in X and Y are an order of magnitude smaller of what they should be.

How do these critical bugs affect the qualification process that ends on the 3rd of January?

‌
content.html:
After spending a significant amount of time debugging why our Inertial + Visual odometers don’t work, we have found out that the IMU readings in the X and Y direction of the linear acceleration are wrong.

This can be reproduced extracting the ground truth velocity of the robot in the simulator, differentiating it, adding the gravity vector, and expressing the resultant quantity in the local reference frame of the robot.

By simple inspection of the IMU signal, it can be seen that the readings for the linear acceleration in X and Y are an order of magnitude smaller of what they should be.

How do these critical bugs affect the qualification process that ends on the 3rd of January?

‌

values.title: ign log playback issue

content.raw:
Followed the instructions on [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim\_log\_playback](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim_log_playback).  

Extracting and starting playback are fine, but it’s looking for the meshes in the docker location:

```
[GUI] [Err] [Ogre2MeshFactory.cc:430] Cannot load null mesh [file:///home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Rescue Randy Sitting/1//meshes/rescue_randy.dae]
[GUI] [Err] [Ogre2MeshFactory.cc:72] Failed to get Ogre item for [file:///home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Rescue Randy Sitting/1//meshes/rescue_randy.dae]
[GUI] [Err] [SceneManager.cc:275] Failed to load geometry for visual: visual
```

Is there a command-line option to substitute something else for this?  I ended up copying my `.ignition` folder over to the home directory it was looking for and `chown`-ing it.

Also - the fast forward/seek doesn’t seem to work?  Hovering over the fast forward button, I can enter a number of steps \(I tried 5000\) and there’s no change.

‌

values.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
I’m following the tutorial with a solution built and tested in catkin workspace. I created Docker image with this recipe:

```
FROM osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:subt_solution_latest

COPY docker ~/subt_ws/install/share
CMD ~/subt_ws/install/share/run_sim.bash
```

`run_sim.bash`:

```
. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.sh

roslaunch st.launch
```

`st.launch`:

```
<launch>
  <node pkg="robot_localization" type="ekf_localization_node" name="robot_localization_ekf_node_odom" clear_params="true">
    <rosparam command="load" file="$(dirname)/ekf_localization.yaml" />
  </node>
  <node pkg="st" type="st_node" name="st_node" clear_params="true"> </node>
</launch> 
```

`docker_compose.yaml`:

```
version: "2.4"
services:

  # The sim container runs Gazebo and all simulation plugins.
  # In this example, two robots are started with the names X1 and X2.
  sim:
    image: osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest
    command: cloudsim_sim.ign headless:=true worldName:=urban_qual robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=COSTAR_HUSKY_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
    networks:
      sim_net:
        ipv4_address: 172.28.1.1
    environment:
      - DISPLAY
      - QT_X11_NO_MITSHM=1
      - XAUTHORITY=/tmp/.docker.xauth
      - IGN_PARTITION=sim
      - IGN_IP=172.28.1.1
    env_file: .env  
    privileged: true
    runtime: nvidia
    security_opt:
      - seccomp=unconfined
    volumes:
      - "/tmp/.docker.xauth:/tmp/.docker.xauth"
      - "/tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix"
      - "/etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro"
      - "/dev/input:/dev/input" 

  # The bridge container relays a sub-set of information from the sim container
  # to the solution container. This bridge container will relay information
  # for the X1 robot
  bridge1:
    image: osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest
    # Relay topics and service for X1
    command: worldName:=urban_qual robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=COSTAR_HUSKY_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
    # The bridge needs two networks. One for simulation and one for the
    # solution.
    networks:
      relay_net1:
        ipv4_address: 172.29.1.1
      sim_net:
        ipv4_address: 172.28.1.2
    environment:
      - IGN_PARTITION=sim
      - IGN_IP=172.28.1.2
      - ROS_MASTER_URI=http://172.29.1.1:11311
    env_file: .env
    depends_on:
      - "sim"

  # The solution container runs control code for a single robot. This
  # solution container connects to the first bridge, and therefore controls
  # the X1 robot.
  solution1:
    image: st:latest
    networks:
      relay_net1:
        ipv4_address: 172.29.1.2
    environment:
      - ROS_MASTER_URI=http://172.29.1.1:11311
    runtime: nvidia
    depends_on:
      - "bridge1"

  
# Definition of the networks.
networks:
  sim_net:
    ipam:
      driver: default
      config:
        - subnet: 172.28.0.0/16
  relay_net1:
    internal: true
    ipam:
      driver: default
      config:
        - subnet: 172.29.0.0/16
```

values.title: Obtain Ground Truth while using SLAM

content.raw:
Hello!

Is there a good way to use the enableGroundTruth:=true option while simultaneously running a SLAM solution, like Cartographer?  This currently seems to create a conflict, since the enableGroundTruth option creates a parent-child relationship between the world frame and the robot frame in the tf tree, but a solution like Cartographer also creates parent-child relationship between the generated map and the robot.  This causes some funny issues when I try to run them together, since I believe the tf package only allows each frame to have one parent frame.  In particular, if I use a tool like view\_frames to monitor the tf tree, the tree seems to flip-flop between the urban\_circuit\_practice\_xx and cartographer map frames as the parent frame to X1.

I would love to be able to record both the actual and the estimated positions at the same time to compare them.
content.html:
Hello!

Is there a good way to use the enableGroundTruth:=true option while simultaneously running a SLAM solution, like Cartographer? This currently seems to create a conflict, since the enableGroundTruth option creates a parent-child relationship between the world frame and the robot frame in the tf tree, but a solution like Cartographer also creates parent-child relationship between the generated map and the robot. This causes some funny issues when I try to run them together, since I believe the tf package only allows each frame to have one parent frame. In particular, if I use a tool like view_frames to monitor the tf tree, the tree seems to flip-flop between the urban_circuit_practice_xx and cartographer map frames as the parent frame to X1.

I would love to be able to record both the actual and the estimated positions at the same time to compare them.

values.title: Sudden loss of RF communication with basestation upon passing the lip in the entrance

content.raw:
With a single X1 or X2 robot, in any of the urban circuit practice worlds, I see a sudden RF exponent increase from 2.5 to infinity \(3.59539e\+307\) upon the robot passing the lip in the entrance. This is despite the base station still being physically visible to the robot. This differs from the tunnel circuit worlds, where base station communication was still available while the robot was near the tunnel entrance, and robots were able to report artifacts without completely exiting the tunnel.

I wanted to check if this behavior is by design?

Example:

```
[Dbg] [VisibilityRfModel.cc:80] Range: 16.4849, Exp: 2.5, TX: 20, RX: -50.4272
...
[Dbg] [VisibilityRfModel.cc:80] Range: 16.9977, Exp: 3.59539e+307, TX: 20, RX: -inf
```

‌
content.html:
With a single X1 or X2 robot, in any of the urban circuit practice worlds, I see a sudden RF exponent increase from 2.5 to infinity (3.59539e+307) upon the robot passing the lip in the entrance. This is despite the base station still being physically visible to the robot. This differs from the tunnel circuit worlds, where base station communication was still available while the robot was near the tunnel entrance, and robots were able to report artifacts without completely exiting the tunnel.

I wanted to check if this behavior is by design?

Example:

[Dbg] [VisibilityRfModel.cc:80] Range: 16.4849, Exp: 2.5, TX: 20, RX: -50.4272
...
[Dbg] [VisibilityRfModel.cc:80] Range: 16.9977, Exp: 3.59539e+307, TX: 20, RX: -inf

‌

values.title: Description of state.tlog, topic dynamic_pose/info

content.raw:
Hello,

could you direct me where to find description of topic `dynamic_pose/info` stored in `state.log` \(log of AWS CloudSim simulation\)? It is `SQLite format 3` and I can see that there are 3 topics: `[(1, '/logs/sdf', 1), (2, '/world/urban_circuit_practice_03/dynamic_pose/info', 2), (3, '/world/urban_circuit_practice_03/changed_state', 3)]`. I even see that all five robots are in a single record as they start to move, but … how to get their position \(x, y, z \+ quaterinion\)?

The motivation is automatic \(or semi-automatic\) validation of simulation results. Single run of 5 robots corresponds to 10GB data and ideally 5 hours of recording “to be checked”, so it would be nice to be able to plug the `state.log` parser as preliminary filter.

I would guess that it is some kind of “protocol buffer” but I have no idea where to find corresponding `.proto` description file.

Thanks in advance for any hint :slight_smile: 

Martin/Robotika Team

values.title: Sporadic move_base failure in CloudSim: "Unable to get starting pose of robot, unable to create global plan"

content.raw:
This is probably just something I’m doing wrong, so my apologies for bothering everyone else with this, but I wanted to ask if anyone else has had move\_base sporadically fail with the error: 

```
Unable to get starting pose of robot, unable to create global plan
```

I’m seeing this sporadically but very frequently in a lot of CloudSim logs. Never saw it happen locally. I was assuming it might be related to one of the CloudSim issues before the urban competition, but now I’m not so sure. When it happens, it fills up the logs with the same message over and over, and the robot never recovers. I’m guessing it might be \(directly or indirectly\) caused by some sort of a SLAM failure, but it just seems a little strange I’ve never had it happen in local testing.

Anyway, I will keep on digging \(pun intended\) into this a lot more here, but just wanted to quickly ask if anyone else has seen something like this?

Thanks, much appreciated!

values.title: Feature Request: Service indicating scoring time period

content.raw: It would be convenient to have a service indicating the start/end times of the simulation scoring period. This would allow better coordination of robots with respect to the simulation period without worrying about potentially changing rules such as automatic scoring start interval or changes to the simulation duration, as well as helping overcome other issues such as robots crashing or unable to communicate due bridge failures that can sometimes make inference of the start time difficult.

This would allow better coordination of robots with respect to the simulation period without worrying about potentially changing rules such as automatic scoring start interval or changes to the simulation duration, as well as helping overcome other issues such as robots crashing or unable to communicate due bridge failures that can sometimes make inference of the start time difficult.

values.title: Is cloudsim totally broken?

content.raw:
Yesterday we wanted to test the new logging that has been enabled on the bridge container to maybe get a closer to solving #261. We started 10 simulations with 1 robot each. Some of them \(after 12 hours\) are still in Pending state. None of them is currently showing any logs \(neither real-time, nor for download\). At least one of them is considered finished because I was able to start yet another simulation. At least one of them was running yesterday as I could see the real time log saying that the battery is running for 27 minutes already.

The solution images work locally without problems.

There is no information available to us that we could act upon. From here it looks just as if the cloudsim is broken :worried: . The logs have to be available **especially** when something goes wrong and not be the first victim of any glitch. So, is the problem on our side? What **is** the problem?

values.title: Camera data significantly delayed when using newest osrf/subt-virtual-testbed image

content.raw:
Using the current osrf/subt-virtual-testbed image, I’m seeing large delays with an increasing backlog of data for the `front/image_raw` camera topic. This affects both the urban and cave worlds.

Example repro steps:

```
ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4
roslaunch subt_example teleop.launch
rviz
```

\(Can also replace urban\_circuit.ign with cave\_circuit.ign, or use another robot base such as X2\)

Looking at the `/X1/front/image_raw` topic in rviz, initially it is fine, but after several seconds the data becomes increasingly delayed and no longer lines up with the current position of the robot.

Also, if I run my robot controller, I start to see error messages similar to the message below as it looks up a tf transform based on each image timestamp. This delay continues to increase, and the machine seems to run out of memory after a while:

```
[ERROR] [1585265942.360834143, 60.804000000]: Lookup would require extrapolation into the past.  Requested time 35.452000000 but the earliest data is at time 50.800000000, when looking up transform from frame [X2N1/base_link/camera_front] to frame [X2N1/map]
```

I’m not sure exactly when this started, but can confirm the image from 12/20 was not affected.

content.html:
In the past we were able to load local folders into the image by doing something similar to

./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed Local_Folder

I know the run.bash needed to be modified by adding something similar to

WORKSPACES=("${ARGS[@]:1}")

for WS_DIR in ${WORKSPACES[@]}
do
WS_DIRNAME=$(basename $WS_DIR)
if [ ! -d $WS_DIR/src ]
then
echo "Other! $WS_DIR"
DOCKER_OPTS="$DOCKER_OPTS -v $WS_DIR:/home/developer/subt_ws/src/$WS_DIRNAME"
else
echo "Workspace! $WS_DIR"
DOCKER_OPTS="$DOCKER_OPTS -v $WS_DIR:/home/developer/workspaces/$WS_DIRNAME"
fi
done

But I am not able to make the image run and open in its terminal.

Do you have a modified run.bash we could use?

values.title: Robots not working with new docker images

content.raw:
As far as I can tell, everything seems to be working fine locally using docker-compose, but in cloudsim \(and also in an AWS environment I’m currently setting up\) the robots are not able to move correctly. Data seems to be getting lost, and I am seeing the following error message in my logs:

```
458.268000000 WARN /X2N1/detect_ros [tcpros_base.py:352(TCPROSServer._tcp_server_callback)] [topics: /clock, /X2N1/front/image_raw, /X2N1/objects, /rosout, /X2N1/debug_image, /statistics] Inbound TCP/IP connection failed: timed out
458.268000000 WARN /X2N1/hazard_detector [tcpros_base.py:352(TCPROSServer._tcp_server_callback)] [topics: /clock, /X2N1/front/image_raw, /rosout, /X2N1/hazard, /statistics] Inbound TCP/IP connection failed: out timed
```

\(Note that both of those lines are from Python modules\)

In the `rostopic_247_1586233084153.log` file I see the following:

```
[rospy.internal][INFO] 2020-04-06 21:27:47,640: topic[/statistics] adding connection to [http://10.40.0.4:36633/], count 13
[rospy.internal][WARNING] 2020-04-06 22:20:10,011: Unknown error initiating TCP/IP socket to 10.40.0.4:45261 (http://10.40.0.4:39845/): Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/ros/melodic/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rospy/impl/tcpros_base.py", line 562, in connect
    self.read_header()
  File "/opt/ros/melodic/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rospy/impl/tcpros_base.py", line 657, in read_header
    self._validate_header(read_ros_handshake_header(sock, self.read_buff, self.protocol.buff_size))
  File "/opt/ros/melodic/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rosgraph/network.py", line 357, in read_ros_handshake_header
    d = sock.recv(buff_size)
error: [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer

[rospy.internal][INFO] 2020-04-06 22:20:10,014: topic[/statistics] removing connection to http://10.40.0.4:39845/
```

This behavior actually looks similar to the #339 issue, and I am seeing some of the same messages in my logs as when that was occurring.

That log is from CloudSim guid `a71032a3-5aca-452e-b2a0-aaae898ca272` which is an example of this behavior.

values.title: Comms Broker subscribe to scene info instead of pose info

content.raw:
See: #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/422/communication-support-for-breadcrumbs-part/diff#comment-144148229

It might be possible to subscribe to /scene/info instead of /pose/info in the CommsBroker.
